sentence.Network_en: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.

sentence.Network_en: In many places surface rocks have been melted, baked by the heat of magma beneath.

sentence.Network_en: Earthquakes commonly accompany volcanic activity on movement of magma deep in the earth.
sentence.Network_cn: 地震通常都伴随着火山活动或地球深处的岩浆运动.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'residue of dregs after evaporation or pressing of a semi-liquid substance'): via Latin from Greek magma (from massein 'knead')

entry.def: Magma is molten rock that is formed in very hot conditions inside the earth.
